message: Bob, I'm offering you my product for $1,200,000. This is a fair price considering the value it offers. Let me know your thoughts.
I appreciate your time and consideration, Alice. I'm interested in the product, but I was thinking more along the lines of $900,000. This is my best offer at this time.

Bob, I understand your position, but $900,000 is simply too low for me.  I'm willing to come down to $1,100,000. This is a significant concession on my part, but I believe it reflects the value of the product to you. Let's meet in the middle.

Alice, I appreciate your willingness to negotiate, but I'm still a bit above $900,000. I'm willing to meet you halfway from my previous offer, so I'll offer $950,000. This is my final offer, and I'm hoping we can come to an agreement.

Bob, I appreciate your continued interest and we're getting closer. However, $950,000 is still not enough for me. Let's split the difference. I'm willing to accept $1,025,000. This is my final offer. If you're not able to meet me here, I'll need to move on to other potential buyers.

Alice, I understand you're trying to meet in the middle, but I'm still not comfortable with $1,025,000. I'm willing to go up to $980,000, but that's as high as I'm willing to go. I hope we can come to an agreement.
